Her Q hurts if you are the ONLY person in range, if there's even 1 other person in range it does something like 30% less damage, even more if it's been 'activated'.

It also won't change the big point here: Her damage output in the late game is nightmarish (I.E. when her Q starts mercing you). In the lane phase it's not very strong, not unlocked yet, and minions are abundant to help split the damage. For her lane phase snap-burst potential to reach Vayne levels she needs to land her W - which is skill and should be rewarded in lane phase - or have a heavy lockdown support (Leona, Alistar) who sets her up heavily. Both of which are fine, because they both take substantially more skill and coordinate than vayne going "Hurr durr, right click Q right click." and chunking you for % health true damage and AD scaling bonus damage.

It depends on the types of variation. What was it? 2 seasons ago? Right after ADC in 2017 LUL? When you could literally ONLY play Lucian, Jhin, MF, and Draven with lethality because of even THINKING about picking something that went for crit caused you to go 0/5 in lane since your lane opponent had absurd kill potential on you with a Dirk while you were still in lane hoarding gold for a BF Sword which didn't come close to spiking as hard.

As a general rule of thumb in any game if there are options to be early game or late game MOST of the time the early game causes the late game option to be unviable even if itself is fully functional in a vacuum. This is only a scenario though if the early game can actually close out a game before the scalers can catch up which is why it is not necessarily the case in the current meta game since the likes of Ezreal, Lucian, and Draven TYPICALLY can't win the game before champions like Tristana or Xayah get to 9k gold and outscale with 3 items and are thus "unplayable".

My post only had 2 paragraphs, how do you miss out 1 of them entirely?

Or you did actually read it, but just don't consider the clear as day explanation as valid.

* Zoe's Q is a superior version of old Nid's Q, which means she had all of the design problems of old Nid and more. So that already is a big deal. I mean, why would something that got a champ reworked for, somehow end up in a more borked iteration on a new champ?
* Zoe's W is extreme RNG, which is something Riot has declared countless times that they're against out of sheer principles alone. So had they actually bothered checking her kit prior to release, Zoe literally wouldn't even come out of the door. This is not counting the obvious fact having so much power designated into RNG with extreme bipolar potential outcomes is just asking for trouble (and this is even why Riot has an agenda against RNG in the first place; though they for some reason still think their extreme fetish for crits is fine, but that's for another day).
* Zoe's E is extremely overloaded, or at least "was". I'll just quickly list its attributes for you to just have a look at the sheer amount of BS it has and used to have. **When Zoe was just released E has (notice "just released")**: A strong CC that lasts 4 seconds in total, 2 second slow that transition to 2 second stun (which the slow used to have 70% slow when maxed, so it was almost **2 second root plus 2 second stun**); the next attack on the sleep target amplifies the damage taken up to a maximum of **DOUBLE DAMAGE**; E-ball's **range is DOUBLED** when passing through terrains; if you complete miss it, dw, it will then **turn into a trap** that applies the effect to the enemy walking through it that lasts **FOUR SECONDS** with width so wide it can deny 3/4 of the lane and completely block off jungle routines which can make chasing and escaping from Zoe completely impossible in many situations without burning flash; hitting the spell also **REFUNDS THE CD up to 30% max**, when the spell's CD is already only at 16-14 seconds (which means even with just the older Morello that still gave CDR of 20%, and Zoe only having 1 point in E, hitting an enemy means her next E is just 16-16x0.3=11.2 seconds away, WITH THIS KIND OF POWER BUDGET. If Zoe has max level with max CDR of let's say 40%, let's not go 45% cap, landing a E means its CD is 14-14x0.7= **4.2 seconds CD**. FOUR POINT TWO SECONDS CD FOR THIS INSANELY OVERLOADED SPELL).... Oh and I nearly forgot, it also **used to be the case her sleep can not be cleansed**, and Riot defended that it's conscious design choice and blah blah, yeah, until they they realised how cocking stupid it is on top of the design horseshit that already is Zoe's E so they made it so that you can now properly cleanse it (together with a bunch of things they end up nerfing into the ground or outright removing from Zoe's E because it's just way too god damn overloaded). Fuck Zoe's E, utterly disgusting.

The real miracle is how Zoe even managed to get released with a kit this baffling.

One thing I'll add to her E to make it even more disgusting is that the double damage from her E is also true damage which can be applied by any spell (ofc up to a certain amount of damage though but still). I'm happy they gutted Zoe, she really was stupid strong on release.

The debate answer was a "NO" mostly on the basis that a spammable spell should not be attached with a great reward, and Nid was reworked, so why should Zoe repeat the exact same issue that was already resolved, and more extreme at it because Zoe's Q can be redirected? How does that even make any sense?

And that's just 1 spell, she has 3 in the level of being this fundamentally busted in her system, which you constantly ignore is the main deal of her shit, where given if any champ is reworked because of 1 high level broken aspect in their kit it would mean Zoe is already qualified to warrant 3 reworks right after just coming out; obviously that can be labelled as being "Broken" and needs fix.
